catalog_info.title: Statistical Sleuthing through Generalized Linear Models
catalog_info.notes: Examples will be drawn from several fields, particularly from biology and social sciences.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Statistics 139 or with permission of instructor.
catalog_info.description: Sequel to Statistics 139, emphasizing common methods for analyzing continuous non-normal and categorical data. Topics include logistic regression, log-linear models, multinomial logit models, proportional odds models for ordinal data, Gamma and inverse-Gaussian models, over-dispersion, analysis of deviance, model selection and criticism, model diagnostics, and an introduction to non-parametric regression methods.
